clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability and Responsiveness of the Chinese Version of the Readiness for Return-To-Work Scale in Lost-time Claimants in Outpatient Occupational Rehabilitation in Taiwan
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability and Responsiveness of the Chinese Version of the Readiness for Return-To-Work Scale in Lost-time Claimants in Outpatient Occupational Rehabilitation in Taiwan

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to measure the reliability and responsiveness of the Chinese version of the readiness for return-to-work (RRTW) scale. We would conduct a multiple-centered, prospective cohort study to require RRTW data in lost-time claimants in outpatient occupational rehabilitation in Taiwan.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of the Readiness for Return-To-Work Scale scores during rehabilitation
primary_outcome.time_frame: The participants do the pretest of RRTW scale in the first week in their work hardening program, finishing the protest in the last week before the program ends. The duration depends on people. (In an average of 4-6 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Using the RRTW scale changes of the pretest and protest data to calculate the responsiveness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from the Readiness for Return-To-Work Scale scores at 1 week
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants do the pretest of RRTW scale in the first week in their work hardening program, and they do the retest after one week.
secondary_outcome.description: Using the pretest and retest data of the Readiness for Return-To-Work (RRTW) scale to calculate the reliability.

study_pop.textblock: 60 lost-time claimants in outpatient occupational rehabilitation in 3 work hardening centers in Taiwan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of occupational injuries
- Participating the work hardening program
- Age from 20-65
- Still not return to work
- Willing to participating the study
